text: Tariq Ahmed Al-Amri (born December 23, 1990) is a Saudi Arabian long-distance runner. He competed at the 2016 Summer Olympics in the men's 5000 metres race; his time of 14:26.90 in the heats did not qualify him for the final. Al-Amri won bronze in the 5000m at the 2017 Asian Athletics Championships, having finished 9th in the 2016 Asian Indoor Athletics Championships in Doha. ==References== Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Saudi Arabian male long-distance runners Category:Olympic athletes of Saudi Arabia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2014 Asian Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2018 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for Saudi Arabia Category:Medalists at the 2018 Asian Games
title: Tariq Al-Amri
